intro: Castanopsis inermis, commonly known as the Chinese tallow tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, dense wood. The tree produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Castanopsis inermis is valued for its timber and has been introduced to other parts of the world for ornamental purposes.
